授業目的: This course is conducted by "Face-to-Face "format. This research project is to learn through "case study" on the basis of the UN relevant issues that aims at providing with graduate students an excellent opportunity to understand research design, feedback on the various project related writings/ drafts, and critique on colleagues' work. After going through "case studies" regarding international issues, students will familiarize themselves with relevant literature, and critical thinking. Identifying and appraising problem-solving options are to be discussed---including developing recommendations and formulating project/programme proposals (ex. conflict and post conflict development, peoples' participation, local government vs central government, gender, etc.). In view of dynamic class discussion in nature, some of the topics would be continued to the following sessions.
到達目標:
1．Students will be able to analyze the complex issues of UN system and the stake holders' relations.
2. Students will be able to understand the UN challenges of socio-economic, environmental and governance fields.
3. Students will be able to formulate project proposal based upon problem solving options through project cycle management method together with policy analysis.
関連科目: All UN and Diplomacy related studies
授業方法: Seminar/Workshop/Lecture style is underlined throughout the course. This class will be held in face-to-face format on campus. Resource person(s) would encourage students for active class discussion in focusing on selected topics. "Simulation" exercise for role play is planned for project formulation module.
